info.title: Pabbly API Documentation
info.description:
We provide the API which follows all the `HTTP` request and based on the `REST` theory.  These API allows you to perform all the actions in your account just by requesting the call. These calls can be fired using any API development  platform like Postman.

Every call is revealed with an URL. The URL of each resource can be obtained by accessing the API Root Endpoint.

tags.name: Email Marketing
tags.description:
Following are the API request examples related to a Pabbly Email Marketing account.

## Authentication Type – 
All the following API requests uses ``Bearer Token`` as authorization channel.

You can get the **Bearer Token** from your Pabbly Email Marketing account under `Integrations` > `Developer API` as shown in the below screenshot and is use it as your ``Bearer Token``

![Bearer Token](https://www.pabbly.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/BearerToken.png "Bearer Token")

tags.name: Subscription Billing
tags.description:
The REST Admin API lets you fire internal actions and intergation with different apps.
Our API supports all the HTTP requesting for calling an action.

Every call is revealed with an URL. The URL of each resource can be obtained by accessing the API Root Endpoint.	
## Authentication Type – 

All the API uses ``Basic Auth`` as authorization channel.

`Username` : **API Key** from your Pabbly Subscription Account

`Password` : **Secret Key** from your Pabbly Subscription Account

**Location of API Key in Pabbly Subscriptions account -**

From your accounts dashboard go to;

**Settings -> API Settings -> Generate the Keys**

![API Key](https://www.pabbly.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Pabbly-API.png "API Key")

**Note** - The Get request API does not contain any form data

get.description: Get all subscribers list id's and names from your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

post.description:
Create a subscriber list with a suitable name in your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

***Body Params*** `JSON` object consisting of the following parameters:

| Variables |  Details |
|----------:|---------:|
| `list_name` | A suitable name for the subscribers list |

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

get.description: Get the list of personalization tags from your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

post.description:
This `POST` request will add Email(s) to the existing Subscriber List of your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

***Body Params*** `JSON` object consisting of the following parameters:

| Variables | Details |
|----------:|--------:|
| `import` | single for importing single subscriber |
| `list_id` | List Id of from your PEM account |
| `subscribers_data` | `JSON` object of subscriber details like name, email, city etc. |

**You can pass your personalization tags that you have created in your PEM account in the `subscribers_data` in the `"key":"value"` pair (all the keys must be in lowercase) for importing further details of a subscriber.**

```
"subscribers_data":{
    "johndoe@gmail.com":{
        ...
        "city":"New York",
        "country":"USA",
        ...
    }
    ...
}
```

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

text/plain.example: {"status":"success","message":"List Updated Successfully, Total Emails In List : 12"}

get.description: Get all the Delivery Servers from your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

get.description: Get the list of all the Email Templates from your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

post.description:
Create an Email Templates in your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

***Body Params*** `JSON` object consisting of the following parameters:

| Variables |  Details |
|----------:|---------:|
| `subject` | A suitable subject for the template |
| `html_body` | An `HTML` as a string with backslashes in front of predefined characters |

You can make use of the onlinestringtools.com and use their escape string tool to convert the `HTML` as string with backslashes.

example.subject: Black Friday Email Template
example.html_body:
Hey {firstname}

Thanks for registering up with Pabbly Email Verification.

We verify emails at a slow speed to guarantee the most accurate email verification results. False positives, Catch-all addresses, unknown addresses are all reduced in the slow email verification.

With Pabbly, you can verify emails in just 3 simple steps -

1. Login to the Pabbly account.

2. Upload your email list, and

3. Click on the "Start Verification" button and that"s it. The verification process will start and you will receive an email notification once the verification process is completed.

Start Verification Now

If you have any questions, simply reply back to this email or get in touch with us here.

Cheers!!

Pabbly Team

E3/49, 3rd Floor, Arera Colony, Bhopal, MP, 462016, India

This email was sent to {email} | Unsubscribe | View in Browser

You are receiving this email because you have signed up on our website or subscribed to our email list.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

post.description:
This request will allow you to send emails from your Pabbly Email Marketing account.

***Body Params*** `JSON` object consisting of the following parameters:

| Variables | Required | Details |
|----------:|-----:|-------:|
| `from_name` | True | From Name for the email |
| `from_email` | True | From Email for the email |
| `subject` | True | Specify a subject for the eamil |
| `delivery_server_id` | True | Through which Delivery Server from your PEM account you want to send emails |
| `template_id` | True | Desired email template from your PEM account |
| `list_ids` | True | Send emails to subscribers of your desired PEM list, use comma separated values for sending to subscribers of multiple lists |
| `exclude_list_ids` | True | Exclude your PEM list, use comma separated values for excluding multiple lists |
| `individual_emails` | True | You can send emails to specific subscriber, use comma separated values for sending email to multiple subscribers |

example.subject: Check out our Black Friday Deal.

schema.example: CP="IDC DSP COR ADM DEVi TAIi PSA PSD IVAi IVDi CONi HIS OUR IND CNT"

get.summary: Get Single Customer via Customer ID
get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to fill the customer Id in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the details in customer like name, email, created date and so on.

put.description:
This is a PUT request API in which you will add the customer Id in Request URL.

In response you will get the new details of the customer on same customer Id. That means the customer Id will remain the same but the details will be changed.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| first_name | Optional | Update the First Name of your customer. |
| last_name | Optional | Update the Last Name of your customer. |
| company_name | Optional | Update the Customer’s company name. |
| website | Optional | Update the Customer’s website name. |
| phone | Optional | Update the Customer’s phone number. |
| billing_address | Optional | Update the billing address of the custoemr. |
| shipping_address | Optional | Update the shipping address of the customer. |
| enable_portal | Optional | Value will be **yes/no** |
| enable_affiliate | Optional | Value will be **yes/no** |

post.description:
Fire the link with POST request and fill the following details in from data.

If the response status is success then a unique customer Id will be generated for that customer.

## Attributes :

| Variables   |      Type      | Details |
|----------|:-------------:|-----------------:|
| first_name |  Required | First Name of your customer |
| last_name |    Required  | Last Name of your customer. |
| email_id | Required | Email address of your customer. |
|Basic Details| Optional | Company name, Website, Phone number, Billing address, Shipping address are the optional fields |

get.summary: Get Single Customer via Customer Email
get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to fill the customer email in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the details in customer like name, email, created date and so on.

This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to fill the customer Id in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the purchase details of that customer like total amount, total refund, total revenue and so on.

A GET request API used to get the details of all the customer in a single page.
Simply used to get the Customer Id and User Id of all the customers.

post.description:
The post request API which is fired to create a new customer with a subscription.

In response you will get a unique customer Id and Subscription Id.

## Attributes

| Variable | Required/Optional | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Basic Details | Required (Card details are required only for Stripe and Test gateway) | First name, Last_name, and Email address of the customer. |
| Card Details | Required, Only If the card detail for this customer is missing. Required only for **Stripe** and **Test gateway** | Card Number, Expiry, and CVV of the customers' CC. |
| gateway_type | Required | It can be one of paypal, stripe, test, custom, offline or free. |
| gateway_id | Required only if gateway_type is custom or want to process payment with the specific gateway | Unique Id of the payment gateway from which the payment is processed. |
| Billing Address | Optional | Add the address details in respective fields. |
| plan_id | Required | Unique Id of the plan which you will assign to this customer. |
| redirect_to | Optional | The customer will be redirected to this link after successful payment. |

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the customer.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the customer Id in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete Customer.

post.description:
Post request API in which you will add the subscription Id in request URL

In response the subscription of that customer will be canceled and the customer will not be billed further.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|cancel_at_end|Required|True if you want cancel at the end of subscription or false if you want to cancel immediately.|

example.message: Your suscription would be cancelled at the end of the term

post.description:
The POST request API. In which you will add the customer Id in the link.

In response you will get the details of the subscribed plan and a subscription Id.

## Atrributes:

| Variable | Type | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| plan_id | Required | Unique Id of the plan which you will assign to this customer. |
| gateway_type | Required | It can be Stripe or Test |
| gateway_id | Required | When there are multiple payment gateways of same kind. Then add the gateway id from which you want to process the payment |
| Card Details | Required, Only If the card detail for this customer is missing. Required only for **Stripe** and **Test gateway** | Card Number, Expiry, and CVV of the customers' CC. |
| method_id | Optional | Payment method id if you want to charge payment from an existing or specific card. |
| redirect_to | Optional | The customer will be redirected to this link after successful payment. |
| coupon_code | Optional | This coupon code will be added to this subscription. |

get.description:
API to be fired with GET request. In the link you will just need to add the subscription Id.

No form data is required in the API. You can just fire the link and get all the details of this subscription like – Billing dates, Product Id, plane name and plan code.

Another GET request API in which you will add the customer Id in the link and fire it.

There is no need to add the form data and in response you will get the details of all the subscription assigned to that particular customer.

With this GET request API you can fetch the details of the scheduled subscription.

You will need to add the subscription Id in the API link and fire it in GET request.

In response you will get the details of old plan, new plans and the scheduled timings.

put.description:
This API can be used to add custom fields in a particular subscription. It will be fired with PUT request. subscription_id will be added in Request URL. In response you will get Success status and the plan checkout page will be updated with the custom fields. ## Attributes | Variable | Type | Details | | --- | --- | --- | | product_id | Required | Unique Id of the product which you will assign to this customer. | | plan_id | Required | Unique Id of the plan which you will assign to this customer. | | card_id | Required | {{payment_method_id}} | offline | | payment_mode | Optional | offline | | coupon_code | Optional | This code will be used by the customer to avail discounts. | | payment_term | Optional | Possible values of payment_term are net0/net15/net30/net45/net60/neteom/neteonm. If this attribute is not used then net0 will be the default value. | | activated_at_val | Optional | Apply the changes immediately or at end of the term.

`immediately -` If you want to apply the changes immediately.

`eot (End of the term) -` If you want to apply the changes at the end of the term. | | price | Optional | Add the amount of the plan | | quantity | Optional | Add the quantity of the plan for which you want to subscribe to your customer. | | setup_fee | Optional | Add the setup fee amount of the plan for which you want to subscribe to your customer. | | addons | Optional | Add the addon IDs & addon quantities | | update_reason | Optional | Add the subscription update reason that will be displayed in the single subscription page. | | Custom Field | Optional | Phone number and additional_magazines in the form data are custom fields. You can add fields according to your needs. |

post.description:
This link will be fired with PUT request.

You will need to add the existing subscription Id in the Request URL

## Attributes

| Variable | Type | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| plan_id | Required | Unique Id of the plan which you will assign to this customer. |
| quantity | Optional | Add the quantity of the plan for which you want to subscribe to your customer. |
| price| Optional | Add the price of the plan for which you want to subscribe to your customer. |
| coupon_code | Optional | Unique coupon code of the plan which you will assign to this customer. |
| setup_fee | Optional | Add the setup fee amount of the plan for which you want to subscribe to your customer. |
| addons | Optional | Add the addon IDs & addon quantities |

get.summary: List All Subscriptions By Customer Id
get.description:
Another GET request API in which you will add the customer Id in the link and fire it.

There is no need to add the form data and in response you will get the details of all the subscription assigned to that particular customer.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the subscription.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the Subscription ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete subscription.

post.description:
Firing this API with proper data will create a Product in your Pabbly Subscriptions account.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|product_name|Required|Name the Product which you are going to sell through Pabbly Subscriptions.|
|description|Optional|Product description is for your reference only.|
|redirect_url|Required|Redirect your customer to a particular page through this option, hosted page data will be sent along. If left blank then they will be redirected to pabbly thank you page.|

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the product.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the product ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete product.

post.description:
This is a POST request API used to create the selling plan for a product. In response you will get the plan Id, Created date and other important details. ## Attributes | Variable | Type | Details | | --- | --- | --- | | product_id | Required | Unique product Id in which you are creating this plan. | | plan_name | Required | Name of the plan. | | plan_code | Required | Plan Code can be same as plan name. This will be displayed at the end of the checkout page link. | | Price | Required | Add the plan amount. This is required or flat_fee/per_unit/ donation/variable | | billing_cycle
`lifetime`\-Is used for Recurring plan until cancel
`specific`\-Is used for Specified number of billing cycle | Required | It can be \`specific/lifetime/onetime' | | billing_cycle_num | Required | Used only when the billing_cycle is ‘Specific’ | | billing_period | Required | It can be
`Monthy Billing` - 'm'
`Yearly Billing` - 'y'
`Weekly Billing` - 'w' | | billing_period_num | Required | It can be the number of month/weeks for the billing frequency. | | setup_fee | Optional | One time payment deducted at the time of purchase only. | | setup_fee_type

`flat_fee` - 'If you want to add the FIXED setup fee'
`per_unit` - 'If you want to add the Quantity-wise Setup fee' | Required | If setup fee amount is set flat_fee/per_unit | | plan_type | Required | flat_fee/per_unit/volume /tiered/stairstep/donation/variable | | tiers
`starting_unit` - Used to add the starting unit of this plan
`ending_unit`\- Used to add the end unit of this plan
`price` - Add the amount of this unit range | Required | If plan type is tiered/volume/stairtstep | | trial_amount | Optional | Enter the amount for for paid trial. | | trial_period | Optional | Assign trial days to your customers. | | trial_type | Required | If trial period is set day/month | | variable_increase_price | Required | If plan type is variable. | | variable_max_price_amount | Required | If plan type is variable. | | variable_type | Required | If plan type is variable sale/hour. | | variable_start_time | Required | If variable_type is hour. | | payment_gateway | Optional | Use selected/all for All or Selected Gateways | | gateways_array | Optional | Add the gateways in arrays, If If the payment gateway is Selected type. | | failed_payment_gateway | Optional | Use selected/all for All or Selected Gateways | | failed_payment_gateway_array | Optional | Add the gateways in arrays, If If the payment gateway is Selected type. | | plan_active | Required | It is active by default. You can deactivate it also. | | plan_description | Optional | Description of the plan. | | redirect_url | Optional | Customer will be redirected to this link after successful payment. | | payment_term | Optional | net0/net15/net30/net45/net60/month/nextmonth. | | specific_keep_live | Optional | live/expire | | meta_data | optional | Pass additional information in plan and track it in subscription details of a customer. |

get.description:
The GET request type API which can be fired directly without adding any data.

You just need to add the API keys of your account and fire the API

In response you will get the details of all the plans of all the products.

put.description:
A PUT request API can be used to update or edit the details of an existing plan. You will need to add the plan Id in Request the URL In response, you will get the new details of the plan on the same plan Id. ## Attribute | Variable | Type | Details | | --- | --- | --- | | redirect_url | Optional | The customer will be redirected to this link after successful payment. | | currency_code | Optional | Add the currency to your account. | | plan_name | Optional | Update the plan name. | | plan_code | Optional | Update the plan code. | | billing_cycle | Optional | specific | | setup_fee | Optional | Fees deducted at the time of first payment only. | | billing_cycle_num | Required if the billing cycle is specific | Update the billing timeline. | | price | Optional | Update the price of the plan. Required only if plan type is flat_fee | | billing_period | Optional | Update the billing period. | | billing_period_num | Optional | Number of billing number of weeks, months, or year. | | plan_active | Optional | True for plan active and false for inactive | | plan_description | Optional | Update the plan description | | plan_type | Optional | flat_fee | | trial_amount | Optional for paid trail | trial_amount | | trial_period | Optional | Add the number of trials | | trial_type | Optional | Required if trial period is set day | | variable_increase_price | Required if plan type is variable | Add the amount to increase price by each time it goes up. | | variable_max_price_amount | Required if plan type is variable | Add the maximum price your product will sell for. | | variable_period_num | Required if plan type is variable | Add the amount, how often to increase the price. | | variable_type | Required if plan type is variable sale | hour | | variable_start_time | Required if variable_type is hour | Add the date and time that the timesale will start. | | payment_gateway | Optional | selected | | gateways_array | Optional | \["615c365d2688ae545d670709",...\] Use this when you use payment gateway as "Selected" | | failed_payment_gateway | Optional | selected | | failed_payment_gateway_array | Optional | \["615c365d2688ae545d670709",...\] Use this when you use payment gateway as "Selected" | | plan_active | Optional | true | | plan_description | Optional | Add the plan description here that you want to display on the checkout page. | | payment_term | Optional | net0 | | specific_keep_live | Optional | live | | meta_data | Optional | {
"value1": "{value_details}",
"value2": "{value_details}",
"value3": "{value_details}"
}
This will help you to pass the hidden custom field data on the checkout page. |

get.summary: List All Plans By Product Id
get.description:
This API will be fired on GET request. You will need to add the Product Id in the link.

Directly fire the API, there is nothing to be add in form data.

In response you will get the details of all the plans related to that particular product.

example-0.summary: List All Plans By Product Id

example-1.summary: List All Plans By Product Id

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the plan.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the Plan ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete plan.

post.description:
The POST request API, which is used to create a new coupon. product_id will be added in the Request URL. ## Attributes | Variable | Are | Details | | --- | --- | --- | | coupon_name | Required | Name of your coupon. | | coupon_code | Required | This code will be used by the customer to avail discounts. | | discount | Required | Discounted number either percent or flat. | | discount_type | Required | It can be -
`percent` - Coupon will be applied as a percent on a subscription.
`flat` - Coupon will be applied as flat on a subscription. | | redemption_type | Required | Choose how many times this coupon will be used.
`onetime`– Will be applied for a single time on a subscription.
`forever` – Forever type discount.
`number_time` – For limited redemption type discount. | | redemption_cycle | Optional | Filled when the redemption type is number time. | | associate_plans | Optional | All plans are selected by default. Or enable this discount for specific plans | | plans_array | Optional | If associated plans is ‘Selected’ then add the plan Id in array. | | valid_upto | Required | Select the future date in which the coupon can be applied. | | apply_to | Required | It can be
`total_amount` - 'The coupon will be applied for total amount including plan, setup fee, addon amount etc.'
`subscription_amount` - 'Apply coupon only to the subscription fee and not to the setup fee or other fees.'
`addon_amount` - 'Apply coupon only to the addon fee and not to the subscription fee or other fees.' | | maximum_redemption | Required | How many times this coupon can be used. |

get.description:
The GET request API in which you will add the product Id in the link.

You can directly fire the API as there is no from data needed.

In response you will get the details of all the coupons associated with that Product. You will also get the data that the particular coupon is associated with how many plans.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the coupon.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the Coupon ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete coupon.

get.description:
This is a GET request API which is used to get the data of a single invoice.

The Invoice Id is added in the link and fired without any formdata.

In response You will get the customer Id user Id, email product Id, plan Id and all the data which is present in the invoice.

Most important you get the status of the Invoice. If the status is paid then the payment is successful from the customer’s end.

get.summary: List All Transactions By Invoice Id
get.description: List all Transactions of a Invoice.

data.description: Charge for Pabbly -  - Testing - Test

get.description:
A GET request type API.

There is need of any from data to use this API.

In response you will get the Invoice Id of all the invoices along with the respective status and also all the other important data like subscription Id, plan Id and so on.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: You can change the page according to your need

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: You can change the per page value according to your need. The max per page value is 50.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: You can choose one of the status to get the invoice all|paid|sent|pending|created|overdue|refunded

post.description:
POST request API. Used to record the payment of any customer.

invoice_id will be added in the Request URL.

In response you will get the ‘Success’ status and the status of invoice will be updated.

## Attributes

| Variable | Are |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|payment_mode|Required|Name the source in which you have collected the payment like cash, bank transfer etc.|
|payment_note|Optional|Add a note in for future reference.|
|transaction|Optional|Add transaction details if any.|

example.payment_note: The custmer has made a cash payout

post.description:
POST request API . can be used the record the transaction of Payment Invoice.

You need to add invoice Id in the link.

In response you will get the ‘Failed’ status and the status of invoice will be updated.

## Attributes

| Variable | Are |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|error_message|Required|Error message received by the payment processor on your server.|
|transaction|Optional|Add transaction details if any.|

example.error_message: Unable to process the purchase transaction

get.summary: List All Invoices By Customer Id
get.description:
A GET request type API. You will add the customer Id in the link and fire it.

There is need of any from data to use this API.

In response you will get the Invoice Id of all the invoices sent to this particular customer with the respective status and also all the other important data like subscription Id, plan Id and so on.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the invoice.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the invoice Id in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete Invoice.

post.description:
POST request API. Can be used t add a new payment method for an existing customer.

In response you will get the ‘success’ status and then you can bill this customer using the newly added payment method.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|gateway_type|Required|Can be stripe only.|
|Basic Details|Required|Nedd to provide the first name, last name, and email address of the customer.|
|Card Details|Required|Card Number, Expiry and CVV will be added in the respective fields. These details will be stored in the payment gateways only.|

put.summary: Update Payment Method For Existing Customer
put.description:
Can be fired to update the payment method for an existing customer.

customer_id will be added in the Request URL.

In response you will get a success message and the next recurring billing of this customer will be deducted from the newly added card.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|Card Details|Required|Card Number, Expiry and CVV will be added in the respective fields. These details will be stored in the payment gateways only.|
|mid|Required|You will need to fire List all payment method API to get the MID.|

get.summary: List All Payment Methods By Customer Id
get.description:
GET request API which will be fired with the customer Id in the link.

Since you are grabbing our some data from the account then you will not need any form data.

In response you will get the details of all the payment method saved on this customers.

get.summary: Get Checkout Page By Product Id
get.description:
The GET request API which can be used to get the links of all the checkout pages associated to a product.

You will need to add the product Id in the API link and fire it.

There is no form data in this call.

In response you will get the plan name, plan code,plan Id and the checkout page link of the plan.

post.description:
A very important API for the developers and majorly used in the integration process.

Get the data from the thank you page link. 

Example – https://www.inkthemes.com/<b>?hostedpage=8ebdaa43b300805b078e66c014ed8625%3A9f42ed7e8275debf7df823bdd1a6cd070b8c2df97c23ae6bcf3f2d469967cee6ab8e614867af1f57df39449308469cb74051b16b5<b/>

Data in bold is the hosted page data

In response you will get the “Success or Failed” and the respective message along with all the important details about the customer and the purchased subscription.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|hostedpage|Required|Get the data from the thank you page link.|

A very important API for the developers and majorly used in getting data from the hosted page.

Get the data from the thank you page link. 

Example – https://www.inkthemes.com/<b>?hostedpage=8ebdaa43b300805b078e66c014ed8625%3A9f42ed7e8275debf7df823bdd1a6cd070b8c2df97c23ae6bcf3f2d469967cee6ab8e614867af1f57df39449308469cb74051b16b5<b/>

Data in bold is the hosted page data

In response you will get the “Success or Failed” and the respective message along with all the important details about the customer and the purchased subscription.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|hostedpage|Required|Get the data from the thank you page link.|

get.summary: List All Transactions By Customer Id
get.description:
A GET request API in which you will add the the customer Id in the link.

Like all the GET request API you will not need to add any form data in the links.

In response you will get the details of all the transaction made by this particular customer.

data.description: Payment success
Invoice paid
Payment success

get.summary: List All Refund By Customer Id
get.description:
Another GET request API in which you will add the customer Id in the link.

No need of form data.

And in response you will get the details of all the refunds made to this particular customer.

data.description: Partial refund as agreed with  the sales team.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the transaction.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the transaction ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete Transaction.

post.description:
This API can be used to Record the Refunds.

The API will be fired with a POST request along with the transaction ID in the API link.

In response, you will get the successful message of Payment Refunded.

This API is used to create the portal session and generate get the signin link of the client portal.

This link can be passed to the customer so that they can login directly into the account.

A POST request API which is fired with the customer Id in the form data.

In response you will get the access URL and the other details like create date, and token Id.	

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|customer_id|Required|Customer Id for which you want to generate the portal session.|
|redirect_url|Optional|Enter the Url where you want to redirect your customer for sign-in |

A POST request API by which you can get the stats of dashboard like total sales, total refund, recurring amount and so on.

In response you can get all the stats which is shown on the dashboard of your Pabbly Subscriptions account.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|product_id|Required|Get the stats product wise or for all products.|
|interval|Required|Fill the interval for States like last 30 days, this_week and so on.|

Another POST request API which can be fired with the same form data as the “Create dashboard stats”. That means you need to add product Id and the interval and fire the API.

In response you will get the sales stats for this particular product. You can get the details of all the customer who has purchased the plans of this product.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|product_id|Required|Get the stats product wise or for all products.|
|interval|Required|Fill the interval for States like last_30_days, this_week and so on.|

post.description:
A POST request API in which you will add the Product Id and the days interval in the form data.

In response you will get the details of all the customer whose recurring billing is going to occur in the selected interval.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|product_id|Required|Get the stats product wise or for all products.|
|interval|Required|Fill the interval for States like last_30_days, this_week and so on.|

get.description:
A GET request API in which you will need to add the plan Id in the link and fire it.

In response you will get the details of the added custom fields in this plan.

This API can be used to get the details of a single add-on.

The request is fired on GET along with the add-on id in the API link.

In response you will get all the details related to that particular add-on.

By this API you can get the details of all the ad-on related to a particular  product.

The API will be fired in GET request along with the product Id in the API link.

In response you will get the details of all the added add-ons of that particular product.

data.name: Extra 5GB Data
data.description: By adding this addon, you'll get extra 5GB data

post.description:
This API can be used to add Add-ons in a plan. This request will be fired with POST request and you will add the plan ID in the API link. In form data you will need to add the billing cycle and details about the add-on and fire the API. In response you will get the details of the added add-on along with the add-on Id. ## Attributes | Variable | Type |Details| | ---------:|----------:|---------:| |billing_period|Required|`Monthly Addon` - "m"
`Yearly Addon` - "y"
`Weekly Addon` - "w"| |billing_cycle|Required|`lifetime` - for recurring add-on
`onetime` - for one time add-on| |status|Required|`true` - for active| |associate_plans|Required|`selected plans` for creating add-on for particular plans, if left blank then it will be applied for all plans| |billing_period_num|Required|Billing frequency of the add-on| |category_array|Optional|This add-on will be shown on all the added categories| |code|Required|Unqiue code of your add-on, Not shown on the checkout page| |name|Required|Name of your add-on| |price|Required|Price of your add-on| |plans_array|Optional|If associate plan is true then add the plan Id's here| |description|Optional|For merchat purpose ony, not shwon on the checkout pages| |product_id|Required|Id of the Product this add-on is associated with|

example.name: Extra 5GB Data
example.description: By adding this addon, you'll get extra 5GB data

data.name: Extra 5GB Data
data.description: By adding this addon, you'll get extra 5GB data

put.description:
This API can be used to update the details of an existing add-on.

The API will be fired with PUT request along with the add-on Id in the API link.

In the form data you will add all the new details for the add-on and fire it.

In response you will get the update details of the existing add-on on the same add-on Id. 

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|name|Optional|Updated name of the add-on.|
|code|Optional|Updated code of the add-on.|
|price|Optional|Updated price of the add-on.|
|category_array|Optional|Updated category of the add-on.|
|status|Optional|Updated status of the Add-on|
|associate_plans|Optional|Updated plans of the add-on|
|billing_cycle|Optional|Updated billing cycle|
|billing_period|Optional|Update billing frequency|
|billing_period_num|Optional|Update billing frequency|
|description|Optional|Updated decription of the add-on|
|plans_array|Optional|New plan array|
|product_id|Optional|Product id with which the add-on is associated|
||||

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the add-on.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the add-on Id in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of delete Addon.

post.description:
You can use this API when you want to create a category for the added add-ons.

The API will be fired in POST request and in the form data you will need to add the category name and product Id.

In response a category will be created which you can add in the add-on.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|category_name|Required|Category name under which your add-on will be nested|
|product_id|Required|The relatable product Id|

get.summary: List All Categories By Product Id:
get.description:
By this API you can get the list of all the available categories in a single product.

The API will be fired in GET request along with the product Id in the link.

In response you will get the details of all the categories added in that particular product.

By this API you can get the details of any particular categories.

The API will be fired in get request along with the category Id in the link.

In response you will get the details of that particular category.

put.description:
This API can be used if you want to update the name of any existing category.

It will be fired in the PUT request along with the category Id in the link.

In the form data you will add the new name -> which you want to assign to that category and fire it.

In response you will get the success message of the updated category.

## Attributes

| Variable | Type |Details|
| ---------:|----------:|---------:|
|category_name|Required|Updated name of the category.|

delete.description:
This API can be used if you want to delete the addon category.

It will be fired in the DELETE request along with the category Id in the link.

In response you will get the success message of the delete addon category.

post.description:
Fire the link with POST request and fill the following details in from data.

If the response status is success then a license code will be generated for that customer.

## Attributes :

| Variables   |      Type      | Details |
|----------|:-------------:|-----------------:|
| Name |  Required | License Name |
| Plan ID |  Required  | Add the Plan for which you want to create License codes |
| Method | Required | List/Auto-generated |
| License Codes | Required | Add license code names that you want to add to the list and provide it to customers |
| Status | Required | Active |

get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to fill the product Id in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the details in the response like name, license ID, method, status and so on.

put.description:
Fire the link with PUT request and fill the following details in from data.

If the response status is success then a license code will be generated for that customer.

## Attributes :

| Variables   |      Type      | Details |
|----------|:-------------:|-----------------:|
| Name |  Required | License Name |
| Plan ID |  Required  | Add the Plan ID for which you want to update License codes |
| Method | Required | List/Auto-generated |
| License Codes | Required | Add license code names that you want to update to the list and provide it to customers |
| Status | Required | Active |

get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to fill the Product ID and License ID in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the details in the response like license name, method, plan ID, license codes and so on.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the license.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the product ID and license ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of deleted license.

get.description:
This API is called with GET request.

You will need to fill the Product ID and License ID in the link and fire it.

In response you will get all the details in the response like, Product ID, License used or not, license codes and so on.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the license code.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the product ID, License code, and license ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of deleted license.

*Note: only unused code will be deleted.*

get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to add the link and fire it with basic auth.

In response you will get all the details like title name, target URL and so on.

This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to add the link and fire it with basic auth.

In response you will get all the details like Click ID, Affiliate Email, and so on.

Also, you can use extra params like GET URL?per_page=3&page=2 in the URL to get the entries per page and for particular page in the response.

delete.description:
This API can be used to delete the click.

The API will be fired with DELETE request along with the Click ID in the API link.

In response you will get the successful message of deleted click.

get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to add the link and fire it with basic auth.

In response you will get all the details like Commission ID, Product details, Affiliate Email, and so on.

Also, you can use extra params like GET URL?per_page=3&page=2 in the URL to get the entries per page and for particular page in the response.

post.description:
The POST request API. In which you will add the payout date.

In response you will get the success message of the payout report generated and then you'll check the report in your Pabbly account.

get.description:
This API is fired with GET request.

You will need to add the link and fire it with basic auth.

In response you will get all the details like title name, target URL and so on.
